data.title: Not a bad hotel but not for loyalty members
data.text: If you are a Marriott loyalty member and happen to be traveling on the weekend there is no benefit staying here.  The lounge is not open, even though the photo I took in the lobby says that it is open from 6am - 10pm daily.  Other Renaissance hotels offer drink discounts and appetizers when they don't have lounges, this does not.  Also with the new apartments being built about 20 feet from the East side of the hotel, someday soon you will be looking into someone's apartment if you have room looking East. The staff was VERY nice and friendly, except the agent who did the checkout.

data.title: Fantastic business stay, 3 blocks to convention center
data.text:
Room was clean, shower was strong, and toiletries were fantastic. Room was smaller than I expected, but probably makes sense for Seattle. Really like the Aveda toiletries. The bathrobe was on another level, soft and fluffy.

Walking distance to the convention center, about 3 blocks. Mild inclines in between. You need to go way down the hill though to reach the shore/Pikes Place Market, so take that into account if that is a problem.

The hotel is on the corner of two streets and there are a few spaces for short-term 10 minute parking on both streets so that you can complete check-in/out activities.

Club lounge was good. I attended one cocktail hour and one breakfast. Beer selection at the cocktail hour was poor for the beer mecca that is Seattle. The spread at cocktail hour was cheeses, cured meats, and some skewers (including tasteless chicken breast). Breakfast spread contained the usual: eggs, sausage, french toast, smoked salmon, pineapple, cantaloupe, honeydew, strawberries.

Staff was helpful and friendly when confronted with unorthodox requests.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Enotty, 

Thank you for your business and your nice review about our hotel and our club lounge. 
I am glad you enjoyed your stay while in Seattle and look forward to have you back soon. 

Rene Neidhart.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Extremely disappointing
data.text:
We stayed here due to its location near the venue for a wedding reception.  We selected a one bedroom corner room with a sofa bed in the living room.  When opened, the sofa bed filled every square inch of space and completely blocked access to the room door for anyone in the bedroom.  The only way in or out was to crawl over the sofa bed.  The main light in the living area was non-functional.  It was late so we did not call down for maintenance.  I am sure they would have come fixed it, but I do expect that things like lights should be checked by the room cleaners each day.

There are much better hotels nearby.  I wish I had gone to one.....

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear traveler 11223, 
Thank you so much for giving us the opportunity to have you as our guest. I am sorry that the configuration of the room did not work out for you during your visit. While the sofa bed combination is practical it does reduce the space available in the living area. It does however provide for a separate sleeping room which is a benefit over a two bedded guest room.
Of course the light fixture should have been working and I do apologize for that.
I do hope you give us another opportunity on your next visit to Seattle. 

Sincerely, 

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Long weekend
data.text: Very comfortable hotel. Extremely helpful staff! The concierge who helped us a few times was knowledgeable and truly took the time for recommendations. When there was a lost phone with an Uber driver, one of the valet/bellman, Max, was over the top helpful! He walked over to the Uber driver, making sure we gals weren't going to get a shake down for the returned phone. The hotel is within walking distance (5 blocks down, 2 blocks over) to get to Pike Market Place. The walk back from the Underground Tour was ok, just uphill. If you are considering this hotel, you would be making a good choice.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Adrienne8123, 
Thank you so much for staying with us while in Seattle and your great review about our staff and service.  I will share your comments about Max with him. 
Service is what it is all about and Max is a great example of our service philosophy.

Thank you and we look forward to have you back soon. 

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Stay.
data.text: The room is clean, the location is good and the staff couldn't have been any nicer.  As is typical for a downtown city hotel, there is a parking charge.  There really were no negatives during my stay and depending on what I need to do in town I'd stay here again.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear germatt2, 
Thank you so much for staying with us and your great review.
We do hope you have another opportunity soon to come back. 

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: If you are here as a tourist, I highly recommend the Marriot Waterfront on Alaskan Ave. instead for a better location
data.text:
This is our 3rd visit to Seattle as a family on vacation.  Previous times, we stayed at the Marriott Waterfront and always admired the location as perfect.

This time the Marriott Waterfront was significantly more expensive and a Seahawk game was our main destination.

The Renaissance is a nice hotel, but probably best for a business customer.
Location is high on a hill.  This makes walking back to the hotel quite a hike for 4 blocks.  I did not feel it was close enough to any of the key tourist destinations.

Mobile check in did not work here, which means I said 2pm check in and the room was not ready.  Never had that happen.

However, I was very pleased with the upgraded room upon request, 27th floor.
Even the upgraded room was quite small, but it did offer a bedroom and living area (2 TVs).  The pull out sofa was very comfortable for our 9 year old, which is not often the case.

There is a big building undergoing construction next door.  Over the weekend they were not working.  However, during the week, the noise from construction started fairly early at 8am.

Refrigerator in the room, but no microwave.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for staying with us and your nice review.
I am glad you enjoyed the corner room with the sofa bed. It is indeed very convenient as a family room. We think our location is perfect for a tourist as we are 15 minutes walking distance to the Market and center of town, shopping /monorail, 20 minutes walking distance to the Pro Stadiums and 10 minutes to light rail which gets you to the Husky stadiums and airport.

I do hope you will be back on your next trip to Seattle. 

Thank you

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great trip to Seattle prior to Alaska cruise
data.text:
We enjoyed our stay at the Renaissance Seattle, Good location, walked to Pike's market, great restaurants with walking distance as well. The Space Needle was conveniently near by.The room was very nice and the customer service was very good.
I would stay at this property again.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for staying with us prior to your cruise. 
I do hope you had a relaxing vacation and hope you will have another opportunity to visit us again.

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very Nice Stay at the Renaissance
data.text:
Pleased overall with our stay here at the end of Oct 2016.  We arrived very early (around 945a), and the front desk staff was quite helpful in securing our luggage, and locating us an excellent upgrade to a corner king suite on a side of the hotel facing away from the neighboring construction.

The hotel was clean and modern.  No problems with our room or the facilities.
The Club lounge is easily the best I've been in.  28th floor, sweeping views of downtown, Elliott Bay, Space Needle, etc.
Gym was tip top - first rate equipment and well laid-out.

Some items of note: 
- Construction next door is an issue right now.  Do what you can to face north or east until it is completed.
- You are close to the "top of the hill".  Walking downhill and up is a chore going East-West.  North is not bad, an easy walk to the shopping core (Nordys, etc).
- You are also close to I-5.  Was not a problem for us on the 25th floor, but lower might be different?  The hotel has "soundproof" windows.

We did not park a car, but we did use BMW's car sharing service (ReachNow).  Cars were usually nearby.  There's always Uber Lyft or a Taxi.  I enjoyed driving the Mini Coops and BMWs and was kinda tired of not-so-awesome Uber drivers.  This hotel, if there is no traffic, is only about 15 minutes door to door to SeaTac.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for your business and your great review of the hotel.
I appreciate your feedback of our lounge and fitness room. The construction next doo is almost done and windows are already being installed.

Looking forward to have you back soon. 

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Below Average Renaissance
data.text: I echo some of the other reviews that stated a stay here is very lackluster for an elite, even for a Platinum Premier. I don't need a big fanfare for my arrival and don't make a fuss over not getting an upgrade but I understand those complaints. However, what does set the bar low here for me is the refusal to adhere to the Marriott benefit for late checkout and the way it was handled during and after the stay is not what I would expect from a Renaissance property. I was denied a late checkout of even one hour, which is now "guaranteed" by Marriott of up to 4pm (four hours after checkout here), and was told I could hang out in the lounge instead. I did venture up to the lounge to complete my call and was met with workers that were refurbishing the lounge. Kudos to fixing up the lounge but the noise from that was loud enough that I left and completed the work I needed to in my car. The room was adequate and the lounge was nice, when not being worked on, but given the benefit denial and the customer service, I do not see myself staying here again in the future given how many hotels are in the area.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear press2meco, 
I am sorry that we did not meet your expectation as a Platinum Reward Member. 
You are correct that we should have extended your stay and I am sorry for not doing so. My Rooms Director will contact you separately to discuss this with you. 
 In the meantime you can be assured that this is isolated incident that we will rectify.
I do hope this this experience will not deter you from giving us another opportunity to have you back at our hotel. 

Sincerely, 
Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Comfortable Business Hotel, Good Location
data.text: Cordial and helpful staff. Comfortable room on northside -- avoid southside as they are putting in a new building which completely blocks the view of the sound. Appropriate furnishings for businesspeople, clean.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for the opportunity to have you as our guest and your nice comments about our hotel. Unfortunately we have lost the view of the sound but still have a great view of city on the Northside of the building.
Looking forward to your next visit. 

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Hotel
data.text: This is a great hotel, the room is really big and clean. The staff are extremely friendly.  The front desk staff check me in around 10:00 in the morning at no extra charge. Great service! Only con, there is no free wifi in the room.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for staying with us and your great review. 
I do appreciate your feedback and hope you have another opportunity soon to come back and visit us again. 

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: beware of next door construction
data.text: changed room 3 times - first one smelled, 2nd one had view of construction of high rise building next door that not only blocked out sunlight, but also we had to keep curtains closed due to workers working parallel to the window (we were on 16th floor). At night, the construction lights were so bright that we thought it was the sun (even with shades closed). they finally moved us to a top floor room with unobstructed views of the city. The concierge lounge is wonderful - great views of the city and decent full breakfast and nightly apps. The plus there is its own bar up there. We dined one evening at the lounge/bar downstairs (restaurant is not open all the time) - burger was so so - unflavorful - and ditto for onion soup. They have nightly entertainment - live bands - a little loud. Service is top notch though, both in concierge and bar downstairs. Location is convenient to dining downtown - 15 min walk to Pike's but last hill to hotel is steep!

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for the opportunity to have you as our guest. 
I am so sorry about the construction issues next door. While we try to accommodate every one in their preferred setting, it is difficult at time to do so. 
 I am glad that in the end we did find a room you liked. 
I am gald to hear that you enjoyed our club lounge.
I do hope that your experience will not deter you from coming back to us and give us another opportunity on your next visit to Seattle.

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good Location, Clean, Great bathroom, would recommend
data.text:
We stayed at this hotel for one night (as expected).  The location is pretty decent, just off the highway, or walkable to the water area.

The room was clean, modern.  The front desk and cleaning staff were amazing.  We had a queen bed and a separate twin bed but we didn't use it.  The beds were comfortable. The hotel was busy but inside the rooms it was quiet.  The room was quite dark with the blinds and curtains closed.  There was construction next door, but it didn't bother us during our stay (a holiday), so be forewarned.  There was a fridge that worked OK.

There was no free wifi outside of the main floor lobby area.  The wifi in the lobby area was limited to surfing and emailing as downloading any file of substance would take way too long in my opinion.  The TV worked well.  There were enough electrical outlets... just wish there was some sort of free wifi (even if quite slow).

Parking was an extra charge.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your visit with us and your nice review.
We do appreciate you staying with us and hope you come back soon. 

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Husband had Conference - Wife Hiked Seattle
data.text: It's not often we both get to go to a conference together, as we both work - but this time I got to go. The first thing to note - is - it is on a good sized hill. (I forgot how hilly Seattle is!) so for those of you who like to walk like me, you get a good work out  going anywhere from the hotel because it's either up or down. That said, you can walk to so many cool spots - first stop - the Library - I know that sounds crazy - but it's one of the coolest libraries I've ever been to. Then you can walk to Pioneer Square, Pikes Public Market, shopping, the ferries, Chinatown. When you get back from your hike, grab a glass of refreshing fruit water available near the lobby door. Okay, but you want to know about the hotel.  It's good. It's clean, cheerful, polished. Offers a salon, fitness center, etc. It is what you expect from a good conference hotel.  Well organized. The room was comfortable and had a decent amount of plugs available for us multi-device peeps.  Handy fridge in the room. I didn't mark it a 5 because it just didn't have any "wow" -  or "extra mile" thing that made it stand out.  It's a good place to stay and the staff are congenial. I'd happily stay there again.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for staying with us while exploring Seattle. 
You description of our location is right on. All of Seattle is in walking distance from our hotel.

I do hope you have another opportunity soon to come back. 

Sincerley, 

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great location and hotel
data.text: Great room, great service and a very nice breakfast. Room service our first night was quick and very good. Can't go wrong staying here. We walked downhill to the ferry and the walk back was a good workout. I utilized the free shoe shine as well.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for the opportunity to have you as our guest.
I do appreciate your great review, and I do hope you will be back for another visit soon. 

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Comfortable and pleasant stay always!
data.text: Stay here on many a visit to Seattle and always appreciate the friendly and approachable staff and their service and recommendations from the concierge. Spacious , quiet rooms with comfortable beds like most Marriott properties. Good location and close proximity around 10 mins walk to Pikes market and shopping malls and other attractions.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Tanya, 
Thank you so much for coming back to stay with us. 
We do appreciate your visits and hope you will be back soon.

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: great location but avoid a room on the west side
data.text: Like other Renaissance Hotels, it is a very nice hotel with a great location.  Most downtown locations are within a pleasant walk of the hotel.  Our only complaint, which in fairness, is beyond the control of the hotel, a new skyscraper is being built on the west side of the hotel thus taking away much, if not all, of the natural light those rooms would have received.  We were initially checked into one of these rooms but, planning to stay five nights, the following day I asked for a change and my request was honored.  A one or two night stay on the west side would not be bad but for five nights, to assign a guest to one of those rooms is unconscionable. One member of the hotel staff behaved as though her only objective was to get hotel guests out of her sight.  She was not at all friendly.  All other employees, however, were very friendly and accommodating.  The restaurant on the second floor offers a very nice breakfast but prices seemed a bit high.  My wife paid $18 for a simple lunch sandwich to go.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for your business and your nice comments about our hotel. I do hope you have another opportunity soon to come back. 

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Hotel, Excellent Location
data.text:
We've stayed in this hotel several times for a week.  The hotel staff is helpful, courteous and friendly.  Anytime we needed a recommendation they were willing to give us suggestions.  

The hotel is quiet and the rooms are spacious, modern and very comfortable.  The bed is comfortable and has the soft bedding you expect in a Renaissance Hotel.  

I highly recommend this property with it's great location, friendly staff and modern rooms.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Melody, 
Thank you so much for coming back and stay with us again.
We do appreciate your loyalty and look forward to your next visit.

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very good
data.text: Nice big and clean rooms, comfortable beds. In a quiet area and in walking distance to Seattle's main attractions. Very friendly staff. The view from my room wasn't special and I'd prefer a shower instead of the bathtub (but that's just a personal preference). Everything was very good.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for your visit and your great feedback about our staff.
I will share this comment with them. Service is how we distinguish our selves from our competition and we like to hear when we meet our guests expectations. 

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A visit to the great northwest
data.text:
The hotel was great.  Location was very good for many of the local attractions.  A new building was being built to the west.  The only notification was a letter from the hotel manager indicating that we could be relocate to another part of the hotel (if rooms were available) should the construction become a problem.  Should have been a notification when the room was booked.  Construction began at 7am even on the weekend.  

The room had a view to the west of downtown Seattle but the new building will minimize the existing view.
